quizzes.title: Knowledge Quiz: Word and Cliche
quizzes.description: Test your knowledge knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Knowledge, cartoon, face. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What are the first names of the comedy team of Rowan and Martin?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Dick and Dan

questions.question: In the B  O Railroad, what does the B stand for?
What word completes the following cliche: The blind leading the ______. ?
What word completes the following cliche: a square ____ in a round hole?
What is correct word to complete the cliche: Face the ______.?
Name the comedy team of the late 60s whose routines include Earache My Eye and Santa Claus and his Old Lady.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Cheech and Chong

questions.question: What is correct word to complete the cliche: like a ___ in a china shop?
Reservoir Dogs, Kill Bill, Jackie Brown
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Tarantino, Quentin

questions.question: What word completes the following cliche: “to make a _____ out of a molehill”?
Topaz, Frenzy, Psycho
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Hitchcock, Alfred

questions.question: Who was the ever faithful friend and comrade-in-arms of Sherlock Holmes?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: John Watson

questions.question: In the Old Testament, whose hair was cut off by the temptress Delilah?
What team of animators is responsible for most of the Saturday morning cartoons?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Hanna and Barbera

questions.question: Which cartoon character was the gentleman friend of Olive Oyle?
Which of the following words usually follows the word zip?

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Eyes and Rap
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, people, bowling. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: In the fall of 1982, seven people in the Chicago area died after taking an over-the-counter medication deliberately laced with cyanide. What brand of medication was it?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Extra Strength Tylenol

questions.question: In 1981, Nintendo developed a video arcade game which featured a giant ape as the villain. The ape would try to stop Mario, the games hero, from reaching and rescuing the damsel in distress by rolling wooden barrels at him. What was the name of this arcade game?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Donkey Kong

questions.question: The 1985-86 Boston Celtics were on top of the world. There had just won their 16th NBA championship and their super star Larry Bird won the MVP. To make things even better, they drafted a young man in 1986 who was considered by many to be the future of the Celtics. Tragically, this young man died of a cocaine overdose just 48 hours after he was drafted. What was the name of this person whose death shocked the country?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Len Bias

questions.question: Lonesome Cowboys, Saturday Night Live, LAmour
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Warhol, Andy

questions.question: The Hills Have Eyes, The Twilight Zone, Cursed
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Craven, Wes

questions.question: Sleepy Hollow, Beetle Juice, Big Fish
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Burton, Tim

questions.question: Bowling for Columbine, And Justice for All, Fahrenheit 9/11
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Moore, Michael

questions.question: Which of these significant tragic events was the last to occur during the decade of the 1980s?

options.text: John Hinckleys assassination attempt on President Ronald Reagan
The Tiananmen Square Massacre in China

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Tiananmen Square Massacre in China

questions.question: Eyes Wide Shut, Full Metal Jacket, Lolita
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Kubrick, Stanley

questions.question: Which television sitcom was not originally on the air at some time during the 1980s?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Good Times

questions.question: Dracula, The Rainmaker, The Godfather
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Coppola, Francis Ford

questions.question: Twin Peaks, Wild at Heart, Hotel Room
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Lynch, David

questions.question: Midnight in the Garden of Good and Evil, Absolute Power, Mystic River
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Eastwood, Clint

questions.question: The Berlin Wall was constructed in 1961 to separate West Berlin and East Germany. Its construction was approved by Soviet leader Nikita Khrushchev. Who was the leader of the Soviet Union when the Berlin Wall was dismantled in 1989?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mikhail Gorbachev

questions.question: This 1980s rap group trio brought rap into the mainstream with the 1986 rap-rock hit Walk This Way, a collaborative effort with the rock band Aerosmith.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Run DMC

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Language and Series
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, actor, jesse. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: The following sentence is written in what language:
Colonel Potter was 1/4 Native American according to the M*A*S*H series. Which Native American group was he related to?
In the very last episode of M*A*S*H*, what did Colonel Potter receive as a goodbye gift from B.J. and Hawkeye?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A salute

questions.question: Comedic actor Jesse Donald Knotts was born on 21 July, in what year?
In questo disco affrontano uno straordinario viaggio alla ricerca delle radici della musica classica is a sentence in what language?
In what language is this line:
Colonel Potter loved to paint and had done several portraits of his fellow members of the 4077 in the M*A*S*H TV series. Those portraits were actually painted by Harry Morgan.
What was Colonel Potters home state according to the M*A*S*H TV series?
According to the M*A*S*H series, what unit of the Army did Colonel Potter belong to during World War I?
This NFL team established their dominance in the 1980s, winning three Super Bowls during the decade.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: San Francisco 49ers

questions.question: I dont feel well is Ik voel me niet lekker in which European language?
In what language does Ich habe Hunger mean Im hungry?
In which film did Don Knotts star as Wheely Applegate?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Herbie Goes to Monte Carlo (1977)

questions.question: The Detroit Tigers defeated the San Diego Padres in the 1984 World Series. The Tigers clinched the series in game 5 when Kirk Gibson hit a three-run homerun off of this famous closer (pitcher).
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Goose Gossage

questions.question: In M*A*S*H, Colonel Potter had received a Purple Heart during World War II. How did he suffer his injury?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: His still blew up

quizzes.title: Knowledge Quiz: Language and Sentence
quizzes.description: Test your knowledge knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Knowledge, border, none. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: I have 10 apples and I give all but 6 away, how many do I have left?
Name the language in which this sentence is written:
In what language is the sentence:
Jai compris tous les mots, jai bien compris, merci is a sentence in what language?
U petom mjesecu 2006 godine Crna Gora se odcijepila od Srbije is in what language?
A doctor walks into an operating room and after looking at a patient says, “I cant operate on him, hes my son.” The doctor is not the patients father. Is this possible?
If a doctor gives you three pills with instructions to take one every half hour, when will you take the last one?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1 hour later

questions.question: Doomo arigatou gozaimasu is a very polite expression which means Thank you very much in what language?
A plane crashes on the border of Canada and the USA, 60 people die. Where do they bury the survivors?

Some months have 30 days and some have 31. How many have 28?
In California, is it possible for a man to marry his widows sister?
Brothers and sisters I have none, but that mans father is my fathers son. Who am I?
Do they have a 4th of July in Great Britian?
If a rooster is sitting on the roof of a barn and lays an egg, it will always roll down the shortest path.

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Characters and Toilet
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, harris, jethro. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Jackie Harris is a character played by Laurie Metcalf on which sitcom?
Which British word is a synonym of toilet?
What would your pet cat use to relieve itself?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Litter Box

questions.question: Mike and Gloria were two of the main characters on which TV show?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All in the Family

questions.question: Jethro Bodine was a character from which of these shows?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Beverly Hillbillies

questions.question: Jaime Sommers, a character stronger than the usual human being, was played by Lindsey Wagner in which TV series?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Bionic Woman

questions.question: In this television series, Wally had a younger brother who pestered him constantly.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Leave it to Beaver

questions.question: On which sitcom did Roxie Roker play Helen Willis?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Jeffersons

questions.question: Which TV show featured the characters Florida and Penny?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Good Times

questions.question: On which TV show were two of the characters called Matthew and Galan?
Thurston Howell was the richest among the characters of which television series?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Gilligans Island

questions.question: This toileting facility, typically used in the case of bedridden persons, usually consists of of a metal, glass, or plastic receptacle.
This low-mounted plumbing fixture, similar in design to a toilet, is used for washing the external genitalia and the anus.
Characters Reverend Jim and Louie worked for the Sunshine Cab Company on which TV show?
This toilet, also referred to as kybo, is a small structure separate from the main building which does not have a flush or sewer attached.

quizzes.title: Knowledge Quiz: People and Toilet
quizzes.description: Test your knowledge knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Knowledge, harris, john. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: This literary character, created by Thomas Harris, is a psychiatrist and serial killer, who practices cannibalism.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Hannibal Lecter

questions.question: This fictional evil and atrocious character, described by John Steinbeck, murders her own parents and ruthlessly uses people around her to serve her own needs.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Cathy Trask

questions.question: This criminal from the novel, ‘Great Expectations’ escapes from prison and later becomes the secret benefactor of the boy who helped him out.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Abel Magwitch

questions.question: This literary criminal, described by Charles Dickens as a “loathsome reptile?, trains a band of young boys to steal and make a living by pickpocketing.
This shrewd and sophisticated female protagonist from the epistolary novel ‘Dangerous Liaisons’ controls and dominates the lives of people around her through sex intrigues.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Marquise de Merteuil

questions.question: This fictional villain is described by Arthur Conan Doyle as the ‘Napoleon of Crime’.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Professor Moriarty

questions.question: This literary villain, mainly driven by greed, is Mr. Wickfield’s clerk. He makes treacherous plans to take control of his employer’s business.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Uriah Heep

questions.question: This extremely ambitious and corrupt fictional character urges her husband to murder Duncan, the King of Scotland, and to take the throne.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Lady Macbeth

questions.question: Which specialized toilet is designed to be used only for urination?
On February 24, 1938 this actress, whose birth name was Frances Ethel Gumm, was given the role of Dorothy in the movie, The Wizard of Oz.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Judy Garland

questions.question: This villainous literary character, created by Mark Twain, murders Dr. Robinson and plans to mutilate Widow Douglas.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Injun Joe

questions.question: This fictional villain, has a reputation of an honest man, but manipulates all people around him. He makes Othello believe that his wife is having an adulterous affair.
The Australian slang term for a toilet is bunny.
This word, which in French means convenient, is sometimes used as a euphemistic term, meaning a toilet.
In the movie, Wizard of Oz, Margaret Hamilton portrayed the Wicked Witch of the West. What was Margarets profession before she turned to acting?
